Node.definition: = exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation
= another name for Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= another name for Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= action by which an individual or group of people sets up a permanent residence in a certain location
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
literally: to add (an activity to one's activities); hence: = action by which humans add additional activities to those that they are currently engaged in
= celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy

Node.gloss: to nag|to pester|to oppress|to cause distress
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to experience distress, either with words or with actions, ► usually with the purpose of forcing that person to make certain concessions
= another name for Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= state of deep sorrow and grief; ◄ caused by the death of a relative or friend or by other tragic circumstances
= state of deep sorrow and grief; ◄ caused by the death of a relative or friend or by other tragic circumstances
= another name for Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

Node.gloss: to set up (a tent)|to erect (a tent)|to encamp
Node.definition: = action by which an individual or group of people settles in a certain location for a limited period of time and often for a specific purpose
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = object shaped like a circle

= action by which a group of humans gather around a town with an army and surround it ► with the purpose of forcing it to surrender by cutting off all supplies, or by attacking it directly with the help of siege works
meaning unsure; possibly: = high wooden structure with platform on top; ► erected for soldiers to be able to fire missiles into a besieged city
= set of constructions used to conquer a city under siege

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= spirit of a dead person, ► consulted by fortune tellers; ≈ an activity forbidden in the law of Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= action by which birds, but also, in a derogatory way, to ghosts and mediums produce high pitched sounds

Node.gloss: to become like fine dust > to disappear
Node.definition: = to become like fine dust and disappear
= state in which an object has opposite surface or sides relatively close together
= a large group of people
= a person considered as not belonging to a certain group, be it religious, ethnic, or social
= a large group of people
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
= a very short interval of time
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= process by which suffering comes upon humans or objects
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God
= hot glowing body of fire

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
= series of pictures or events in mind of sleeping person; ≈ associated with things that disappear in a moment
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= a large group of people

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
denominative of צָבָא (צָבָא) = action by which humans engage in warfare
= another name for Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

Node.gloss: to nag|to pester|to oppress|to cause distress
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to experience distress, either with words or with actions, ► usually with the purpose of forcing that person to make certain concessions
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= state in which humans are exceedingly thirsty and long for water
= a large group of people

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
denominative of צָבָא (צָבָא) = action by which humans engage in warfare
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

Node.gloss: to be astonished|to be stupefied|to be confused
Node.definition: = process by which humans are deeply emotionally affected by a difficult situation, to the extent that they do not know how to respond
= process by which humans become intoxicated ◄ as a result of having too much alcohol

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

= alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness

Node.gloss: to pour out a spirit of deep sleep (over someone)
Node.definition: literally: to pour out a spirit of deep sleep; hence: = causative action by which deities use their power to bring a state of deep sleep over humans, ≈ here used figuratively to denote a lack of prophetic vision
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a spiritual entity coming over humans and triggering attitudes corresponding to its character and purpose
= state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with having dreams and visions, sometimes with being inactive
literally: to close (someone's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to be unable to see prophetic visions, ◄ as if their eyes were closed

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= someone who receives divine messages, primarily by means of visions

Node.gloss: to cover (someone's) face > to make (someone) blind
Node.definition: literally: to cover (someone's) face; hence: = causative action by which deities make it impossible for humans to see certain things
= process by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to know how|to be skilful at
Node.definition: literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans speak written words aloud

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
= to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to know how|to be skilful at
Node.definition: literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans speak written words aloud

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to know how|to be skilful at
Node.definition: literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans have the experience, skill, and expertise to carry out a particular activity
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to draw near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans move to a location closer to a point of reference
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which humans, deities, or animals treat other humans, deities, times, or objects with honor and respect
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans experience fear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
= process by which an action is repeated or continued

Node.gloss: to perish|to come to an end
Node.definition: = process by which an event comes to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which certain information is not generally known, ◄ as if it were physically hidden
= exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to hide|to keep from knowing|to conceal
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause others not to be aware of certain information, ◄ as if by physically hiding it

= a place where there is little or no light, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: upside down; hence: = state in which a person's behavior is totally different from that of their peers

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= a person who makes pottery out of fired clay
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= an object produced by humans or deities, ◄ described as an artifact shaped from clay by an artisan

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
literally: little fewness; hence: = a very short period of time
= process by which an object changes into something else
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
= land that is suitable for agriculture ◄ as a result of fertility and sufficient rain
= land that is suitable for agriculture ◄ as a result of fertility and sufficient rain
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which an action is repeated or continued

= state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= to disappear from existence
= state in which a person is a strong and powerful enemy, who is thinks high of himself and is prone to violence, and usually does not fear God
literally: to finish; hence: = process by which humans and objects completely disappear from existence
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

Node.gloss: to bring guilt upon|to cause to be declared guilty
Node.definition: = causative action by which a human being brings upon someone else the responsibility for a wrongful act against God or someone else, ► which brings upon that person a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties
= action by which someone places a trap ► in order to catch an animal; ≈ associated with aggression and control
literally: to turn (someone) away; hence: = action by which humans or deities show their unwillingness to help (other) humans
= something that has no value and hence does not profit anyone
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
= change of complexion as a result of blood leaving the face; ◄ caused by feelings of shame

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to sanctify (one's) name > to show (one's) greatness
Node.definition: literally: to sanctify (one's) name; hence: = action by which God asserts his greatness ◄ by proving himself holy (קָדֹושׁ) through his actions
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= action by which humans acknowledge the holiness of God and certain times of the year that are important to him, and act accordingly

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= action by which humans speak with anger and resentment
= process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

= causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech
